STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 14, 2020
Ursula Ahart
Federation of Youth Services
548 East Grand Blvd
Detroit, MI 48207
RE: License #: CB820201475
Transitional Living Program
548 E Grand Blvd
Detroit, MI 48207
Dear Ms. Ahart:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/10/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Vivian D. Malleck, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3284
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following: Compliance met.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is
in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following: Compliance
met.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
 DHHS Policy – FOM 801 Dental Examination Schedule
Dental examinations are required for children 3 years of age and older as follows:
A dental examination within six months before entry into foster care or an initial
dental examination shall be completed not more than 90 calendar days after entry
into a foster care out of home placement.
A dental examination shall be obtained at least every 12 months unless a greater
frequency is indicated.
One of three independent living files reviewed did not have a dental examination
completed within six months before entry or a dental examination completed within
90 days after entry.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Covid-19 work and stay at home executive orders hindered some of the
timeliness of signatures on treatment plans and uploads of monthly budgets
in MiSACWIS during this inspection. These items were given latitude for this
inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Follow Covid 19 executive orders and communication issuances.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Transitional Living Program submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
 Transitional Living Program is in compliance with their 09/2019 interim
inspection corrective action plan as there are no repeat citations in this
inspection.
 Transitional Living Program is in compliance with SI2020C0420030. The
agency reviewed job expectations with staff.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
09/14/2020
________________________________________
Vivian D. Malleck Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 21, 2020
________________________________________
Linda D. Tansil Date
Area Manager
